div1.p: Russell paraphrases telegrams and letters, enclosing one from White, concerning new yellow fever cases in Mexico and Africa.

August 28, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find inclosed copy of a letter received
last week from Doctor White with reference to the yellow fever
situation at Panuco. We have since received a telegram (on
August 23) from Doctor White as follows:

Connor wires positive case Panuco We
meet Vera Cruz tomorrow Going to Panuco
or Merida as situation demands
and on August 25 we received the following telegram from Doc-
tor Connor at Vera Cruz:

Telephone message was received August 25 from the
firm Ichabod T. Williams and Sons advising that they had re-
ceived a cable on August 21 from their representative in West
Africa as follows:

Grand Bassam in quarantine yellow fever
Many Europeans dying Delay of arrival of
men if possible until further notice.
Two or three days later a second cable was received as fol-
lows:

Can you send very urgent for French Govern-
ment one thousand doses interaides vaccine
- 2 -
Doctor Henry R. Carter, 28 August.
one hundred doses interaides serum against
yellow fever.

The United States Public Health Service has informed
this company that they have no information about yellow fever
in West Africa. And curiously enough, the Bull Steamship Line
has had cables since the 21st of August referring to the arrival
and loading of a steamer on this coast without any reference to
yellow fever. We have cabled Mr. Gunn requesting him to get
any facts that are available from the French Secretary of State
for the Colonies.
We shall keep you advised of developments.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell
Acting General Director. Doctor Henry R. Carter
New Glasgow P.O.
Amherst County
Virginia
“Geddes”
